“ A brilliant love affair ! [[The Billionaire]252-the billionaire ’s Wake - up - call Girl]253-the billionaire ’s wake - up - call girl …

When [[my]0-i manager]254-my manager assigns [me]0-i the task of finding a new wake up call service for [[our]255-our CEO]256-our ceo , [I]0-i think , how hard can this be ? Answer : practically impossible . It turns out that [no wake - up call company]257-no wake - up call company in [the world]258-the world will take [him]256-our ceo on as [a client]259-a client . [They]260-they ’ve all had enough of [his]256-our ceo surly personality . So in an effort not to lose [my]0-i job , [I]0-i secretly start making the calls [myself]0-i , every day at 4:30 am sharp . OMG yes [you]261-you read that right — four freaking thirty in the morning . Confession : [I]0-i ’m not [the nicest wake - up - call girl at that hour]262-the nicest wake - up - call girl at that hour . Hello ! Who wakes up before the roosters are even crowing ? Luckily [he]256-our ceo does n’t seem to mind [my]0-i get - [your]261-you - ass - out - of - bed attitude . Day by day [we]255-our ’re becoming closer , and the calls start turning hot , like pay - by - the - minute hot and oh - so - wild . [Snuggled]96-snuggled under the covers with the moonlight streaming in the windows , [we]255-our divulge [our]255-our secrets to [each other]2337-each other , but the one thing that [he]256-our ceo can never find out is that [the sexy vixen who wakes [him]256-our ceo up every morning]264-the sexy vixen who wakes him up every morning is just the lowly assistant who wears frumpy dresses . [I]0-i can only imagine [his]256-our ceo disappointment . Now [he]256-our ceo wants to take [me]0-i out on a date and [he]256-our ceo ’s scouring [Manhattan]1-manhattan to find [me]0-i . [He]256-our ceo ’s [an overachieving billionaire bent on a mission]265-an overachieving billionaire bent on a mission . How much longer can [I]0-i keep up this charade ?

Adventure is worthwhile in itself . [Amelia Earhart

One

Lizzie]97-amelia earhart

Looking back , maybe [I]0-i should ’ve noticed the red flags . The unusually large sign - on bonus , for example — payable only after [I]0-i lasted thirty days on the job . Who ca n’t last in a job for thirty days ? That was [my]0-i thought when [I]0-i applied for this position . And then there were the strange looks [[my]0-i co - workers]266-my co - workers would give [me]0-i when [I]0-i went around introducing [myself]0-i as [[Vossameer Inc.]98-vossameer ’s new social media manager]267-vossameer inc. ’s new social media manager . “ [I]0-i ’m here to jazz up [our]2338-our online image , ”[0-i] [I]0-i ’d explain . In [the elevator]268-the elevator , on [the communications floor]269-the communications floor , down in [the sleek and elegant lobby]270-the sleek and elegant lobby , just these strange looks . [Uncertain]99-uncertain smiles . [One woman]271-one woman ’s mouth formed into an alarmed “ o ”[271-one woman] before [she]271-one woman introduced [herself]271-one woman back to [me]0-i . At first [I]0-i chalked it up to company - wide cluelessness about social media . After all , [Vossameer]98-vossameer did n’t even have a Facebook page when [I]0-i started three weeks ago . But now as [I]0-i watch [[my]0-i boss]272-my boss [Sasha]100-sasha fret and frown over the PowerPoint report [I]0-i created to show how perfectly [I]0-i nailed [my]0-i assignment , [I]0-i ’m starting to think a little bit harder about those red flags . [She]100-sasha clicks to a page that shows examples of [my]0-i successful , industry - appropriate posts and a graph of [my]0-i stunning engagement numbers . [She]100-sasha sucks in a breath . Winces . What ? Trust [me]0-i , Facebook engagement was no easy feat ; [Vossameer]98-vossameer ’s most exciting product is hemostatic gel for use in traumatic wound - care situations . Another wince . A frown . Was [I]0-i the clueless one all along ? Was [I]0-i misreading the looks [I]0-i was getting from [[my]0-i new co - workers]273-my new co - workers ? Am [I]0-i like [the traveler in [Transylvania]2-transylvania]274-the traveler in transylvania who excitedly tells [all the villagers]275-all the villagers about finding [an awesome free castle to stay in]276-an awesome free castle to stay in ? OMG , [I]0-i have [the whole place]277-the whole place to [myself]0-i because [the owner]278-the owner only comes out at night . Is n’t that wonderful ? Score ! High five ! [I]0-i hold [my]0-i breath as [she]100-sasha clicks from page to page . [Sasha]100-sasha has a severe blonde bob , a love of nautical - looking outfits , and a Cruella De Vil makeup style , though to be fair , it might be a poorly lit home mirror . “ Mmm … ”[100-sasha] [she]100-sasha says finally . And it ’s not a yum type of mmm . It ’s an uh - oh type of mmmm . “ Is there a problem ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i ask . [She]100-sasha just shakes [her]100-sasha head . As though the problem goes beyond words . Like [she]100-sasha asked for an interim report and [I]0-i gave [her]100-sasha a handful of peanut shells with the salt licked off . [She]100-sasha clicks to another graph of positive results and again [she]100-sasha furrows [her]100-sasha dark and dramatically arched brows — [I]0-i see it in the reflection on the screen . “ The engagement numbers are already better than [most of [[Vossameer]98-vossameer ’s peers]2340-vossameer ’s peers]2339-most of vossameer ’s peers , ”[0-i] [I]0-i point out . Crickets . Actually , not even crickets . “ Crickets ”[100-sasha] suggests little beings are happily chirping away in [a field]279-a field . What [I]0-i hear is more like the silent gloom of stones in [a forgotten parking lot]280-a forgotten parking lot . [She]100-sasha clicks to the next page . [I]0-i think [people]2343-people will stay longer . ”[0-i] Trust [me]0-i , that ’s a nice way of putting it . [The current Vossameer site]281-the current vossameer site looks like [it]281-the current vossameer site was made by [depressed robots]282-depressed robots in 1998 . Three

Four

Theo

[I]0-i have a love - hate relationship with uncompleted puzzles . Unanswered questions . Unsolved problems . [I]0-i find them compelling , yet utterly tormenting . [People]2343-people say [I]0-i ’m [a brilliant chemist]540-a brilliant chemist , but honestly , [I]0-i just ca n’t stand when problems that clearly have solutions go unsolved . [I]0-i happen to be working on the most important problem of [my]0-i career : how to create a dehydrated hemostatic agent with vascular repair properties or , in [layperson]541-layperson ’s terms , a dehydrated version of [my]0-i original Vossameer gel , which helps stave off blood loss . [I]0-i know it ’s technically possible . It has to be . This new formula could save a lot of lives . It would be light and portable , perfect for small first - aid kits . It could be issued to [soldiers]542-soldiers . Shared with [aid workers]543-aid workers . Kept in [remote villages]544-remote villages where medical transport can take days . It would be [my]0-i most important breakthrough ever . And with [Locke]123-locke ’s reach into nongovernmental and [refugee organizations around [the world]258-the world]545-refugee organizations around the world , it would instantly go where it ’s needed the most . Meanwhile , [people]2343-people die from car crashes , gunshots , farm accidents when [they]2343-people might have been saved by the ready availability of the new formula . It torments [me]0-i that [I]0-i ca n’t work faster , and really , how has [nobody else]548-nobody else figured this out ? The chemistry of it should be so doable . [I]0-i can feel it right there in the air , waiting for [somebody]346-somebody to pluck it out . But [nobody]307-nobody has . So [I]0-i have to . [I]0-i know it ’s possible . Sometimes [I]0-i feel like [I]0-i ’m running a hellish race where , the moment [I]0-i think [I]0-i ’m nearing the end , the finish line vanishes and reappears in the distance . And then [I]0-i speed up , trying desperately to reach it , only to have [it]551-it move again . Forever out of [my]0-i reach . Five

[Lizzie

Nineteen

Lizzie

[I]0-i ’m working on the Instagram strategy when [Sasha]100-sasha messages [me]0-i to meet [her]100-sasha in [the marketing meeting room]1136-the marketing meeting room . Thirty - Two

Theo

[My]0-i race for the formula used to be the only thing on the landscape of [my]0-i life . Now it exists alongside kitchen things and ironic cookies and hotel trysts and long afternoon walks when [I]0-i should be working . It lives in a world where conflicted emotions can be contained in one simple , fierce word over the phone . Where beauty is an asymmetrical freckle . Where baby goats play . Where [I]0-i can wake up and [Lizzie]190-theo is the first thing [I]0-i see . And [I]0-i lie there loving everything about [her]190-theo so hard that it wakes [her]190-theo up . [I]0-i return to the whiteboard before [I]0-i think too hard about [her]190-theo leaving , about the very real possibility that [I]0-i might not be able to prevent it , hard as [I]0-i might try . And really , those baby goat videos . The ridiculous way [they]1727-they hop while [they]1727-they ’re running . Or more like they pop into the air , mid - run , and it ’s so cute , [you]1728-you ca n’t look away . [The baby goats]1729-the baby goats seem to inspire [each other]2337-each other to jump more — [one]1156-one starts doing it , and then [the others]1640-the others follow . [Each one]1733-each one acts on its own , like individual kernels of popcorn , pop - pop - popping . [I]0-i think about that for a while , how it ’s random , but there ’s a certain strange logic to the sequence . [I]0-i ’m staring at the board , and that ’s when [I]0-i see it — a roundabout way to link the remaining water molecules together to keep a stable compound while still removing enough of them to get the dehydration [I]0-i need . It is possible ? Is this it ? Heart pounding , [I]0-i go to [my]0-i other board and start capturing it , capturing everything , writing as fast as [I]0-i can . The ideas pour out . [I]0-i scribble , feeling like [I]0-i ’m in a trance . This is it . The answer is right here . It was there all along . It ’s magnificent .

Epilogue

[Theo]94-theo New Year ’s Day ; eight months later [Fargo]13-fargo , [North Dakota]80-north dakota

[I]0-i stand at the front of [the tiny prairie church]2015-the tiny prairie church , adjusting [my]0-i cuff links . There ’s [a fiddler]2016-a fiddler , [a friend of [the Cooper family]2018-the cooper family]2017-a friend of the cooper family , playing wedding songs in the corner . [I]0-i adjust [my]0-i sleeve , trying to get it even with the other sleeve . [Willow]140-willow pokes [me]0-i in the back . “ [They]3214-they ’re fine ! [You]0-i ’re perfect ! ”[140-willow] [I]0-i turn to face [her]140-willow . Per - fect , [she]140-willow mouths .
